docs.title: ts2g<sup>2</sup>
docs.text:
TS2G2 stands for "timeseries to graphs and back". The library implements a variety of strategies to convert timeseries into graphs, and convert graphs into sequences.

stream = TimeseriesArrayStream([2, 1, 3, 2, 1, 3, 2, 1, 3, 2, 1, 3])
timeseries = Timeseries(stream)
g = timeseries.to_graph(NaturalVisibilityGraphStrategy())
sequence = g.to_sequence(RandomWalkSequenceGenerationStrategy(), sequence_length=500)

For a more detailed example, look at the Amazon stocks demo.

Many of the methods implemented in this library are described in Silva, Vanessa Freitas, et al. "Time series analysis via network science: Concepts and algorithms." Wiley Interdisciplinary Reviews: Data Mining and Knowledge Discovery 11.3 (2021): e1404. Nevertheless, the library also includes additional techniques found in other works from the scientific literature.

This package is being developed as part of the Graph-Massivizer project. The package is a joint effort between the Jožef Stefan Institute, the University of Twente, the Vrije Universiteit Amsterdam, the University of Klagenfurt, the University of Bologna, and Peracton.

docs.title: Implemented features
docs.text: # Visibility Graph Graph type Constraints Undirected Directed Weighted Penetration Angle 1 Natural Visibility Graph          X             X             X             X             X      2 Horizontal Visibility Graph        X               X             X              X             X      3 Difference Visibility Graph

docs.title: References table
docs.text: # Visibility Graph Graph type Constraints Undirected Directed Weighted Penetration Angle 1 Natural Visibility Graph ref ref ref ref,        ref 2 Horizontal Visibility Graph ref ref ref ref,        ref 3 Difference Visibility Graph

docs.title: Graphs to timeseries conversion
docs.text:
Graphs are converted back to timeseries by sampling node values from the graph following different strategies. The following strategies have been implemented so far:

  • random node
  • random node neighbour
  • random node degree
  • random walk
  • random walk with restart
  • random walk with jump

docs.title: Publications
docs.text:
When using this work for research purposes, we would appreciate it if the following references could be included:

Below we provide a curated list of papers related to our research in this area:

docs.text:

import os
import sys
nb_dir = os.path.split(os.getcwd())[0]
if nb_dir not in sys.path:
    sys.path.append(nb_dir)

from core import model
from input_output import input as inp
import from_graph.strategy_to_time_sequence as tts
import to_graph.strategy_linking_graph as gls
import to_graph.strategy_linking_multi_graphs as mgl
import to_graph.strategy_to_graph as tgs
import os import sys nb_dir = os.path.split(os.getcwd())[0] if nb_dir not in sys.path: sys.path.append(nb_dir) from core import model from input_output import input as inp import from_graph.strategy_to_time_sequence as tts import to_graph.strategy_linking_graph as gls import to_graph.strategy_linking_multi_graphs as mgl import to_graph.strategy_to_graph as tgs In [9]: Copied! 
amazon_path = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), "tutorial_data", "AMZN.csv")
apple_path = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), "tutorial_data", "APPLE.csv")
amazon_path = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), "tutorial_data", "AMZN.csv") apple_path = os.path.join(os.getcwd(), "tutorial_data", "APPLE.csv") In [10]: Copied! 
test = model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(amazon_path, "Close").from_csv())\
    .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(60, 90))\
    .process()\
    .to_graph(tgs.BuildTimeseriesToGraphNaturalVisibilityStrategy().with_limit(1).get_strategy())\
    .add_edge(0,2)\
    .add_edge(13, 21, weight = 17)\
    .link(gls.LinkNodesWithinGraph().by_value(gls.StrategyLinkingGraphByValueWithinRange(2)).seasonalities(15))\
    .draw("blue")
test = model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(amazon_path, "Close").from_csv())\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(60, 90))\ .process()\ .to_graph(tgs.BuildTimeseriesToGraphNaturalVisibilityStrategy().with_limit(1).get_strategy())\ .add_edge(0,2)\ .add_edge(13, 21, weight = 17)\ .link(gls.LinkNodesWithinGraph().by_value(gls.StrategyLinkingGraphByValueWithinRange(2)).seasonalities(15))\ .draw("blue") In [11]: Copied! 
x = model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\
    .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(60, 120))\
    .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSlidingWindow(5))\
    .process()\
    .to_graph(tgs.BuildTimeseriesToGraphNaturalVisibilityStrategy().get_strategy())\
    .link(mgl.LinkGraphs().sliding_window())\
    .combine_identical_nodes_slid_win()\
    .draw("red")
x = model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(60, 120))\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSlidingWindow(5))\ .process()\ .to_graph(tgs.BuildTimeseriesToGraphNaturalVisibilityStrategy().get_strategy())\ .link(mgl.LinkGraphs().sliding_window())\ .combine_identical_nodes_slid_win()\ .draw("red") In [12]: Copied! 
i = model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\
    .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(60, 90))\
    .process()\
    .add(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\
        .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(90, 120))\
        .process())\
    .add(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\
        .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(150, 180))\
        .process())\
    .to_graph(tgs.BuildTimeseriesToGraphNaturalVisibilityStrategy().with_limit(1).get_strategy())\
    .link(mgl.LinkGraphs().time_cooccurrence())\
    .link(gls.LinkNodesWithinGraph().by_value(gls.StrategyLinkingGraphByValueWithinRange(0.5)))\
    .combine_identical_nodes()\
    .draw("brown")
i = model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(60, 90))\ .process()\ .add(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(90, 120))\ .process())\ .add(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(150, 180))\ .process())\ .to_graph(tgs.BuildTimeseriesToGraphNaturalVisibilityStrategy().with_limit(1).get_strategy())\ .link(mgl.LinkGraphs().time_cooccurrence())\ .link(gls.LinkNodesWithinGraph().by_value(gls.StrategyLinkingGraphByValueWithinRange(0.5)))\ .combine_identical_nodes()\ .draw("brown") In [13]: Copied! 
j = model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\
    .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(60, 110))\
    .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSlidingWindow(5))\
    .process()\
    .add(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\
         .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(90, 140))\
            .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSlidingWindow(5))\
                .process()\
                .add(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\
                    .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(150, 200))\
                        .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSlidingWindow(5))\
                            .process()))\
    .to_graph(tgs.BuildTimeseriesToGraphNaturalVisibilityStrategy().get_strategy())\
    .link(mgl.LinkGraphs().sliding_window().time_cooccurrence())\
    .combine_identical_nodes_slid_win()\
    .link(gls.LinkNodesWithinGraph().seasonalities(15))\
    .draw("green")
j = model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(60, 110))\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSlidingWindow(5))\ .process()\ .add(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(90, 140))\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSlidingWindow(5))\ .process()\ .add(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite(inp.CsvStock(apple_path, "Close").from_csv())\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation(150, 200))\ .add_strategy(model.TimeseriesPreprocessingSlidingWindow(5))\ .process()))\ .to_graph(tgs.BuildTimeseriesToGraphNaturalVisibilityStrategy().get_strategy())\ .link(mgl.LinkGraphs().sliding_window().time_cooccurrence())\ .combine_identical_nodes_slid_win()\ .link(gls.LinkNodesWithinGraph().seasonalities(15))\ .draw("green") In [14]: Copied! 
model.GraphToTS(test)\
    .next_node_strategy(tts.StrategySelectNectNodeRandomlyAcrossGraphs())\
    .next_value_strategy(tts.StrategyNextValueInNodeRoundRobin().skip_every_x_steps(1))\
    .ts_length(100)\
    .to_multiple_time_sequences()\
    .draw()
model.GraphToTS(test)\ .next_node_strategy(tts.StrategySelectNectNodeRandomlyAcrossGraphs())\ .next_value_strategy(tts.StrategyNextValueInNodeRoundRobin().skip_every_x_steps(1))\ .ts_length(100)\ .to_multiple_time_sequences()\ .draw()

    .next_value_strategy(tts.StrategyNextValueInNodeRandomForSlidingWindow().skip_every_x_steps(1))\
    .ts_length(50)\

We can also convert our multivriate graphs back to multiple time series.

    .next_node_strategy(tts.StrategySelectNectNodeRandomlyAcrossGraphs().change_graphs_every_x_steps(2))\
    .next_value_strategy(tts.StrategyNextValueInNodeRoundRobin().skip_every_x_steps(1))\
    .ts_length(50)\
    .to_multiple_time_sequences()\
    .draw()

docs.title: Demo: sequences <-> networks¶
docs.text: The following notebook provides a demonstration how the ts2g2 library can be used to convert time series into graphs and graphs into time series. To that end, we use a dataset with the history of daily prices of Amazon stock (AMZN) and Apple stock (APPLE). All the column desinpiptions are provided. Currency is USD.

docs.title: Accessing data¶
docs.text: We first get path to the data.

docs.title: Converting time series to graph¶
docs.text: Here are two examples of conversion of data from time serie to graph. Second one is inpeated using sliding window mechanism. That means its nodes are smaller graphs inpeated based on a segments of data (length = 5).

docs.title: Combining multiple graphs¶
docs.text: We can store and combine multiple of already inpeated objects TimeSeriesToGraph into one object MultivariateTimeSeriesToGraph

docs.title: Back to time series¶
docs.text: We can convert existing graphs back to time series based on our strategy.

docs.title: CsvRead
docs.text: Extracts data from a csv file.

docs.title: CsvStock
docs.text:
Bases: CsvRead

Returns proccessed data from csv file sorted by "Date".

Attributes:

  • path: path to csv file with data
  • column: which column of data do we extract

docs.title: from_csv()
docs.text: Extracts the data using set attributes.

docs.title: XmlRead
docs.text: Extracts data from an xml file.

docs.title: XmlSomething
docs.text:
Bases: XmlRead

One of the ways of extracting the data from xml file.

Attributes:

  • path: path to csv file with data
  • item: which item are we observing
  • season: are we observing values annually or interim

docs.title: from_xml()
docs.text: Extracts the data using set attributes.

docs.title: Graph
docs.text:
Stores already made graph, allows us to add edges and links between nodes.

Attributes:

  • graph: object networkx.Graph

docs.title: add_edge(node_1, node_2, weight=None)
docs.text: Adds edge between node_1 and node_2.

docs.title: combine_identical_nodes()
docs.text: Combines nodes that have same value of attribute self.attribute if graph is classical graph and nodes that are identical graphs if graph is created using sliding window mechanism.

docs.title: combine_identical_nodes_slid_win()
docs.text: Combines nodes that have same value of attribute self.attribute if graph is classical graph and nodes that are identical graphs if graph is created using sliding window mechanism.

docs.title: draw(color='black')
docs.text: Draws the created graph

docs.title: link(link_strategy)
docs.text: Links nodes based on link_strategy. link_strategy is object of class Link.

docs.title: GraphMaster
docs.text:
Turns graphs back to timeseries.

Attributes:

  • graph: networkx.Graph object
  • node_strategy: strategy_to_time_sequence.StrategySelectNextNode object
  • value_strategy: strategy_to_time_sequence.StrategyNextValueInNode object

docs.title: draw()
docs.text: Draws timeseries.

docs.title: plot_timeseries(sequence, title, x_legend, y_legend, color)
docs.text: Function to sets parameters to draw timeseries.

docs.title: to_multiple_time_sequences()
docs.text: Converts graph into time sequences.

docs.title: to_time_sequence()
docs.text: Adjusts parameters nodes and data_nodes to fit function to_multiple_time_sequences.

docs.title: GraphSlidWin
docs.text:
Bases: GraphMaster

Converts graphs made using sliding window mechanism back to timeseries

docs.title: GraphToTS
docs.text:
Bases: GraphMaster

Converts ordinary graphs back to timeseries.

docs.title: Timeseries
docs.text: Saves extracted data as timeseries.

docs.title: TimeseriesPreprocessing
docs.text: Processes timeseries.

docs.title: TimeseriesPreprocessingComposite
docs.text:
Composites processing strategies, allowing us to use multiple of them.

Attributes:

  • ts: Timeseries object with extracted timeseries

docs.title: TimeseriesPreprocessingSegmentation
docs.text:
Bases: TimeseriesPreprocessing

Returns a designated segment from timeseries.

Attributes:

  • segmen_start: start of the segment
  • segment_end: end of the segment

docs.title: TimeseriesPreprocessingSlidingWindow
docs.text:
Bases: TimeseriesPreprocessing

Returns an array of segments made with sliding window mechanism.

Attributes:

  • win_size: size of the creted segments
  • move_len: tells for how many data does window move until next segment

docs.title: TimeseriesView
docs.text:
Stores one or more already processed timeseries, then changes them to graph using provided strategy. If we have multiple timie series turned to graphs, we can link them into one multivariate graph.

Attributes:

  • ts: processed timeseries
  • graph: networkx.Graph object

docs.title: LinkNodesWithinGraph
docs.text: Builder class for linking nodes within one graph, through which we can access linking strategies.

docs.title: by_value(strategy)
docs.text: Notes that we want to connect nodes based on values and strategy.

docs.title: seasonalities(period)
docs.text: Notes that we want to connect based on seasonalities, ad sets the period parameter.

docs.title: StrategyLinkingGraph
docs.text:
Links nodes within graph.

Attributes:

  • graph: networkx.Graph object
  • strategy_precedence: tells in which order should the strategies be excetuted

docs.title: StrategyLinkingGraphBySeasonalities
docs.text:
Bases: StrategyLinkingGraph

Links all nodes that are sequentially self.period apart.

Attributes:

  • period: tells how far apart must two nodes be to be linked

docs.title: StrategyLinkingGraphByValue
docs.text:
Bases: StrategyLinkingGraph

Links nodes based on their value.

docs.title: StrategyLinkingGraphByValueWithinRange
docs.text:
Bases: StrategyLinkingGraphByValue

Links nodes whose value difference is within range of allowed difference.

Attributes:

  • allowed_difference: tells us the allowed difference between values of two nodes for the nodes to be linked together

docs.title: LinkGraphs
docs.text:
Builder class for linking multiple graphs, through which we can access linking strategies.

Attributes:

  • graph: networkx.Graph object
  • graphs: dictionary of networkx.Graph objects
  • command_array: an array that stores linking strategies

docs.title: sliding_window()
docs.text: Notes that we want to connect graphs in a multivariate graph to create sliding window graph.

docs.title: time_cooccurrence()
docs.text: Notes that we want to connect graphs in a multivariate graph based on time co-ocurrance.

docs.title: StrategyLinkingMultipleGraphs
docs.text:
Links multiple graphs together.

Attributes:

  • graph: networkx.Graph object
  • graphs: dictionary of networkx.Graph objects
  • strategy_precedence: tells in which order should the strategies be excetuted

docs.title: StrategyLinkingMultipleGraphsByTimeCooccurrence
docs.text:
Bases: StrategyLinkingMultipleGraphs

Links nodes from multiple graphs based on their sequential order.

docs.title: StrategyLinkingMultipleGraphsSlidingWindow
docs.text:
Bases: StrategyLinkingMultipleGraphs

Sequentially links graphs made by sliding window mechanism.

docs.title: BuildStrategyForTimeseriesToGraph
docs.text:
Sets and returns a strategy with which we can convert timeseries into graphs.

Attributes:

  • visibility: an array of visibility constraints strategies

docs.title: get_strategy()
docs.text: Returns strategy.

docs.title: with_angle(angle)
docs.text: Sets an angle in which range must a node be to be considered for connection.

docs.title: with_limit(limit)
docs.text: Sets a limit as to how many data instances two nodes must be apart to be considered for connection.

docs.title: BuildTimeseriesToGraphHorizontalVisibilityStrategy
docs.text:
Bases: BuildStrategyForTimeseriesToGraph

As initial strategy sets Horizontal visibility strategy.

docs.title: BuildTimeseriesToGraphNaturalVisibilityStrategy
docs.text:
Bases: BuildStrategyForTimeseriesToGraph

As initial strategy sets Natural visibility strategy.

docs.title: StrategyNextValueInNode
docs.text:
Stores strategy to chose next value in the selected node.

Attributes:

  • skip: tells us how many values do we skip before appending next one

docs.title: StrategyNextValueInNodeRandom
docs.text:
Bases: StrategyNextValueInNode

Chooses next value in selected node randomly.

docs.title: StrategyNextValueInNodeRandomForSlidingWindow
docs.text:
Bases: StrategyNextValueInNode

Chooses next value in selected node randomly in graph made with sliding window mechanism.

docs.title: StrategyNextValueInNodeRoundRobin
docs.text:
Bases: StrategyNextValueInNode

Chooses next value in selected node sequentially, in the same order as they were saved.

docs.title: StrategyNextValueInNodeRoundRobinForSlidingWindow
docs.text:
Bases: StrategyNextValueInNode

Chooses next value in selected node sequentially for graph made with sliding window mechanism, in the same order as they were saved.

docs.title: StrategySelectNectNodeRandomlyAcrossGraphs
docs.text:
Bases: StrategySelectNextNode

Walks through all graphs in a multivariate graph and chooses next node randomly.

docs.title: next_node(i, graph_index, nodes, switch, node)
docs.text: From neighbors of the previous node randomly chooses next node.

docs.title: StrategySelectNextNode
docs.text:
Stores strategy to chose next node from the neighbors of the previous node.

Attributes:

  • change_graphs: tells how long we walk through one graph, before switching to next one
  • graph: networkx.Graph object

docs.title: StrategySelectNextNodeRandomlyFromFirstGraph
docs.text:
Bases: StrategySelectNextNode

Walks through first graph and chooses next node randomly.

docs.title: next_node(i, graph_index, nodes, switch, node)
docs.text: From neighbors of the previous node randomly chooses next node.
